LogBuffer Class Reference

An iostream streambuf that prefixes each new line with the date and time and handles other things related to MC2 logging. More...

#include <LogBuffer.h>

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

  • LogBuffer ()
    Initializes the LogBuffer.
  • virtual ~LogBuffer ()
    Cleans up.
  • void setPrefix (const char *prefix)
    Set an extra logging prefix.

Protected Member Functions

  • void notify ()
    Notifies any registered handlers.
  • int overflow (int c)
    Called when there's a new character to output.
  • int underflow ()
    Called to read a character from the input, doesn't advance to the next character.
  • int uflow ()
    Called to read a character from the input, advances to the next character.
  • int sync ()
    Called to sync internal state with external representation.

Private Types

  • enum Sizes { TIME_BUFF_SIZE = 128 }

Private Member Functions

  • int putTime ()
    Outputs the first half of the (date, time).
  • int putLevel ()
    Outputs the second half of the prefix (the level).

Private Attributes

  • bool m_newline
    Flag that's set to true when encounter a newline.
  • bool m_magic
    Flag that's set when we're doing magic (handling our special manipulators (info, warn, err).
  • int m_level
    The log level we're using.
  • char * m_buffer
    Our character buffer, needed for the Notifiers.
  • char m_timeBuf [TIME_BUFF_SIZE]
    Last timestamp.
  • char m_levelBuf [32]
    Last level string.
  • int m_bufPos
    Current position in the buffer.
  • const char * m_prefix
    The prefix string.

Static Private Attributes

  • const int BUFFERSIZE = 32768

Detailed Description

An iostream streambuf that prefixes each new line with the date and time and handles other things related to MC2 logging.
